note.p: Scottish physician, statistician, and religious writer. MD, Edinburgh. Established a private practice in Edinburgh. First superintendent of statistics for the General Office, Edinburgh, 1855. Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh.

Scottish way of birth and death (database), University of Glasgow, Department of Economic and Social History, http://www.gla.ac.uk/departments/scottishwayofbirthanddeath/leadingactors/superintendentsofstatistics/ (accessed May 2009).
